nodes.name: DatasetStructured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.details:
This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc.

The data has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

nodes.name: DataWrangling
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by applying each of the Rules specified
nodes.details:
Rename one column to another
rename col:c1 to c2;

Drop Column
drop col:col4

Delete columns with some condition
delete col:col3 > 44

Substring col:col2 0,3
get substring between 0 and 3rd column from the column col2

Trim Values : Removes leading and trailing whitespace from a string value. 

set col:Name value: trim(Name)

Sets the new value of Name column to be trim(Name)

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: rules
fields.title: Rules
fields.description: Rules to be applied on column and rows

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed
